Not bad, it was broken at launch and that got it a bad rep so no one really payed attention to it even when they fixed it. Campaign map is huge though, good for darthmod or empire total factions (I think thats the name of the mod). Multiplayer is eh kinda dead and a bit broken, Extreme range rifle units, Nuclear howitzers, And Light dragoons that are more accurate than infantry... But if you get good you will ignore these things. Although i dont think the game is worth it at 20.00$. Buy Napoleon Total War if you like multiplayer. reviewText:
The game is a good game. I may only have 30 hours but I have made a list of pro's and cons

Pros
- A lot of things to attack, lot's of fun time ;)
-Good training system
-Good defense systems (Forts)
Cons
-Terrible music (It's like ♥♥♥♥ing japense tea drinking music while your brutually killing other people)
-Bad animations, If I launch a unit to go melee and go have a cluster♥♥♥♥ with the enenmy unit they do terrible because they have all these annoying animations

Sad to say but this game isn't that great. Mainly because of the AI, in a game were alliances and diplomacy are so essential, you'd think the AI would be great. Its the complete opposite. Allies won't help at all, city states that are allied to you at the start of the game drag you into wars with super powers you can't possibly win and if you break the alliance you lose ALL your allies, and everyone will hate you and go to war with you. Another thing, navies. Navies are very key to the game (as you can imagine) but sadly its very very hard to build one. You start off with no navy to speak of, while other countries (Spain, France) have many fleets. You can try to build a navy, but before its big enough another nation will come along and destroy it. Finally my last issue is up keep of armies. The game is called Total War for a good reason, you are always at war on multiple fronts (which is annoying as you have to put all your money into war and you can't improve your nation). Which means you will need multiple armies, which is hard at the start because your allies wont help and you will get bankrupt, your troops will leave you and you will get overrun. I have played this game alot (I got the game on a disk before I got it on steam hence the measly two hours on record) and have won world domination on hard difficulty. This game is playable but it will be one miserable ride.
However this some moments can be quite good, like when thousands of your cavalry charge down those damn rebels. And when you look over whole continents that belong to you. And when you finally crush filthy France and Spain for constantly hindering your progress. There are good moments and the tears, pain and self harm make it worth it. So maybe you should give it a go. I'm just some kid with too much time on my hands what do I know.

Final Verdict: 7/10

reviewText: Empire: Total War provides at least 200 hours of fun (per campaign). You can play as any great European nation in the Early 1700s and lead her armies to victory on the battlefield, on the high seas, in diplomacy and in scientific and civil achievement. Playing as Great Britain provides an awesome historically accurate experience, from defending settlements with militia against Native American raids, creating a trading fleet, crushing pirates, building better roads, heavily taxing the Americans and using company men to make inroads into India.
Yeah, get it if its cheap. Decent Game.

The world is divided into three theaters, the Americas, India, and Eurpope allowing you to engage in wars in three differant parts of the world at once (both on land and sea). I strongly recomend this game for anyone who is a fan of the franchise or is looking for a 1700's/1800's strategy game.

reviewText: Worth the money, good for strategy players and those new to it, the system has been simplified in recruitment and economics, allowing easier introduction to the more modern Total War games.

When it comes to replayability this is the most replayable game in the total war series. It has 3 continents  and 4 trading regions.
When it comes to battles this offers a lot of different units ( meele infantry, ranged infantry, meele cavalry, ranged cavalry, elephants, cannons, mortars, rockets, grenades ) and a lot of sea units ( small ships, galeys, frigates, heavy ships of the line, rocket ships, steam ships). And a lot of sieges ( open towns, artillery forts, star forts).
When it comes to campaing it offers military, diplomacy, economics and sabotage.
What more do you want?!
10/10 would steamroll the world again XD

PS: If you want more hardcore gameplay, download Darthmod"."

Infantry and naval combat is done very well and is always enjoyable. The DLC is , however, a little bit useless and it could be given as an unlockable for completing the campaign for that nation, in my opinion this would enhance the replay value a lot.

Pros,
+Great combat
+Traversing the game world on mighty campaigns is amazing.
+Taxes and Construction are easier in this game which means you take less time faffing about with tax and more time killing your fellow man
+More brutal and gritty than others in the franchise

Cons,
-Graphics could be better (but this can be forgiven as it came out in 2008)
-A.I is poor in some aspects (e.g Troops sometimes will not follow orders and prefer to be shot in the mouth or have their stomach slashed open by a bayonet)
-Lack of Assasins charging through my ranks and then murdering my general with a tomohawk (Disappointed).

Final Verdict,

9/10  Great game and the pros definately out weight the cons. Would buy again.If you like Rts games then this is a must buy. Happy to have spent nearly 2 full days playing this game. Another great from the lads over at Creative Assembly .

reviewText: You can annex France. 10/10.

>start a game as the Maharatha Confederacy
>randomly trade southern India for East Prussia.
>Poland and Courtland declare war on me
>stack army and anally bombard them into submission
>take over minor provinces and control a good portion of central europe while also converting to hinduism
>approach win conditions and realize I have to take over southern India again

>sweden has a military alliance with prussia and also goes to war

>wage war on the ottoman empire and persia for kicks
>kick their asses thanks to my pact with austria
>send a fleet to the american theatre and wipe out the pirates
>try to help the Americans in the revolutionary war
>watch them get slaughtered by the british
>meanwhile send troops to portugal
>destroy sweden
>take a land invasion of portugal and subsequently spain
>france and britain declare war on me
>currently fighting WWI with Britain, France, and the remaining Spanish colonies vs India, Russia, and Austria

10/10 Would definitly start WWI with India again.

reviewText: I bet the brits didnt like the campaign...

Recently in my playthrough playing as France (and doing quite well I might add) I tried to get on the good side of the surrounding powerful nations such as Spain and Britain. So my main objective was trying to gain land without the threat of being mass murdered, I did many other attacks on smaller nations such as the native americans and indians (not racist, but they are really weak) and gained quite a bit of land as well as keeping hostilities in Europe, all happy and friendly. I gained quite a bit of power as I built my armies, gaining more and more elite soldiers along with maitaining my budget, as well as with keeping up with the new technology (like your hip parents try to do). I was doing more than fine now and rekted everyone in North America leaving only me and the 13 colonies, which was now taken over by Britain. I didn't want to start a war equalivent to what a modern-day nuclear war would look like, and would rather avoid turning my ETW into a Fallout game.\nAnyway, back on track, I rekted North America and went back to home sweet Europe. After a few turns, a war broke out between Hannover and Westphilia and I happened to be allied with Hannover. You'll know Westphilia is directly east of France if you play the game, and so I was basically about to crush another metaphoric pebble with my big French boot. So I go and send about 1700 men to besiege it, and another army of about 1500 just in case anything went wrong against the 1600 Westphilian men defending the capital, and proceeded to crush them sustaining barely any casualties other then a small light infantry regiment retreating. Well, I successfully commited genocide wiping them off the face of the Earth and laughed when the A Region Has Been Defeated" message appeared. I was in a good mood for obvious reasons
date: and decided to generously handed over the Westphilia territory to the monsters who started the small Holocaust. Hannover. Everytime I play this game I will remember that mistake. I gave them the territory and was slapped in the face with the harshest words ever spoken in the 1700's

reviewText: Empire Total War is the best Total War game out there. In Shogun 2 and Rome 2 sure the graphics are better, but there is only one map in those games. In Empire there are three campaign maps in one. America, Europe and India. It is also good because there are a lot of diverse nations to play as. I was able to conquer the world twice, that shows how much I love this game.
If you like 18th century politics,large scale RTS battles and obliterating France,this is the game for you!

reviewText: Норм так
Go to war like a sir.

Probably my favorite out of all the Total War games. The map covers more of the world than any of the others and lets you conquor India, the Americas and everything inbetween. Combat is easy to get into but also strategically satisfying. However, it is not without its problems. The main one for me being balancing issues between different factions where some can have far superior late game units to others. The agent system is also inferior to some of the newer games like Shogun 2. Despite these issues, I still love the game. Being able to take control of a nation and make it a global empire is very satisfying.

Here's a list of some of the awesome things I was able to do in my campaigns:
-Turning Sweden into the world's most powerful country.
-Making the Ottomans colonise America.
-Fight off pirate fleets in the Caribbean.
-Amass enought wealth to buy land from other empires.
Best strategy game on the market
One of my all-time favorite games. I love the era. I hope they remake it with the most recent diplomacy and economic upgrades of the latest Rome.

Do not read this! Do not trust this review! Becouse I am still sick. I am not thinking straight. I am here alone... I am listening Chopin and destroying mine enemies. I am playing Austria... No one trust me no more, but at least I got that one city that I need to have... Oh yes, I wanted to play this first playthrough quickly. Becouse I wantend to try out Warpath Campaign, before I have to go back to real world. Where is my love? Where is my woman? I am alone here. Alone. Captain's log. Day 15: My men have started a mutiny. I must make an example of their leader. The New World riches awaits me. Wait what? What happened to quest for justice for Native Americans? Listen to me, do not play this game when you are sick.

There is a campain where you reserch new technologys, or you can go online and battle against and with other players. You can have HUGE (laggy) battles with 3-8 teams battling at once! And ALL this for only $20! This is a great game, and I definitely reccomend it.

reviewText: Great game. I have played quite a lot of this game over the years and i have throughly enjoyed myself and still do, i always end up coming back to this game time and time again. The theatre system really helps to make your empire feel huge as it stretches several continents. The combat can get a bit boring at times when your troops just stand there exchanging fire but there is much more strategical depth to it then that. The variation of units isn't bad and with the DLC and mods there is a lot of unique units. I feel that this game has a lot of replayablity because every campaign is different and there are soo many different ways you can approach empire building, there is also a lot of depth into unit research which add new formations and equipment to you units which can change the way you play. This is one of my favorite games of all time, i definetly recommend this game if you have enjoyed any of the other total war games. But if you have played napoleon total war you might find some things lacking like having client states and less ship variation but having theatres really makes up for it in my opinion.

Great game *IF* you have Darthmod, as Darthmod turns this game into a great game with intelligent ai, realistic sounds/ effects, realistic unit ranges etc; however, if one does not wish to bother with mods at all, then i would skip this game and move to a diffrent total war title.
Great for campaign.

After putting in a few days worth of my life into this game over the past few weeks I feel slightly more qualified to write a review now. This is the second Total War game I've played, I put a few hundred hours into Medieval II so I won't be comparing it to any other TW games.

Campaign Mode: 8/10
Battle Mode: 7/10
Naval Battle: 8/10
Land Battle: 6/10
Soundtrack: 9/10
Multiplayer: 5/10
Overall: 8/10
I would definitely recommend buying this if you’re a fan of strategy games however I would wait until it’s on sale simply because of how damn buggy it was. I had my first save game corrupted after about 50 turns and after that I had numerous crashes and bugs. The AI was pretty brutal on the campaign map but almost laughably easy to fight against in battle modes, there were numerous times where I could fight off armies numerous times larger than my own simply by letting them charge and eat my canister shot.
Excellent strategy game!

To me, this was the best in the Total War series until we got to a few games after. No matter what they say about the issues, it allowed me to go and conquer the world. And I personally love the 18th Century style warfare.
Just great!\n
One of the best Total Wars.\nIf there was just a co-op campaign,I would marry this piece of war.\n7/10.
I like this game though.

reviewText:
When it comes to replayability this is the most replayable game in the total war series. It has 3 continents  and 4 trading regions.
When it comes to battles this offers a lot of different units ( meele infantry, ranged infantry, meele cavalry, ranged cavalry, elephants, cannons, mortars, rockets, grenades ) and a lot of sea units ( small ships, galeys, frigates, heavy ships of the line, rocket ships, steam ships). And a lot of sieges ( open towns, artillery forts, star forts).
When it comes to campaing it offers military, diplomacy, economics and sabotage.
What more do you want?!
10/10 would steamroll the world again XD

PS: If you want more hardcore gameplay, download Darthmod"."
Worth the money, good for strategy players and those new to it, the system has been simplified in recruitment and economics, allowing easier introduction to the more modern Total War games.

reviewText: Conquer the world!!!!!!\nI love Total War, and this is the best Total War yet (well, Rome Barbarian invasion does give it a bit of a run for it's money but not as many things explode in that so...)\nAnyway, if you think the $20 it costs to buy this game is better suited to gathering dust in you're wallet, you're an idiot. Plain and simple, i said it. Unless you're a hobo, then it's kind of an obligation to buy this game, because to be honest, the only excuse NOT to make the purchase RIGHT NOW, is that you're afraid you'll overdose on awsomeness after playing it for any period of time (if that DOES happen, just close the game, take deep breaths, and delete some of you're best save files, because believe me, too much Awsomeness in one day can lead to a serious Total War addiction).

Oh boy writing a recommendation for Empire....\n\nWell, with all the crap surrounding the release now history for quite a while, and stability markedly improved, vanilla is, dare I say, playable. Though who plays vanilla in a Total War game a year or more after its release? Half the game is buried in the modding community. If your system can handle it (300-500 man units is really taxing if you play on Ultra) Darth Mod (and DM Ultimate Commander) is a great realism mod that patches up the AI as best as possible as well.
A very accurate depiction of the time period Not that I would totally know". It has very historicaly accurate models
date: and the campaign mode is enjoyable as each country. Total war is just a great series for any sort of RTS or Civilization lovers."

reviewText: For a great high graphic strategy game with resounding multiplayer and an excellent single player campaign. This game is Amazing!!!!!

One of the most addictive games I've ever played. Put in all my game hours in the first week of playing. It's the kind of game you're up until 4am playing and figure you ought to really get to bed but can't wait to play the next day. Granted I've only played 1 campaign with Great Britain, but the different nations seem varied enough and the gameplay style and turn based nature of the game are just so gripping. I was a big fan of the board game RISK and for me this is like a more in depth, but by no means alienating version of that game.

Played as Poland-Lithuania

Took Over the entirety of Europe

Taxed everybody like a crazed dictator and watched as my population plummet from starvation

Watched as my entire empire fall apart into many smaller nations

10/10 Would be Hitler again

reviewText: Empire: Total War is greit game buy it :)

1. Play as Prussia with all the unti DLCs (in total all DLCs are like 12ish dollars, in the US atleast, which is decent)
2. declare war on all divided german states etc Saxony, Wertumberg, Hannover, the UP, the Rhineland and Bavaria.
3. by declaring war on bavaria and saxony, France, Austria and Poland join into the war effort against you
4. its now prussia versus half of the euorpean world
5. march across saxony, hannover and bavaria in 6 years and annex them for the glorious Reich
6. reunite Austria and Prussia by right of war, currently now 6 german states are united.
7. with france pressing into the western front deploy the majority of ur force in the east and annexx poland
8. spain and russia get butthurt and declare war on my Reich
9. the western front crumbles, and the eastern shatters
10. reform into a republic and try to buddy buddy up to everyone after my leader dies.
10/10 would create my own Reich again, you can even reform the british into the new roman empire and get some glory, there are some many options, stop debating GET THIS GAME
IMPORTANT IMPORTANT IMPORTANT: you can NOT cheat in this game as in Rome 1, Medival total war, etc etc, you CANNOT CHEAT IN THIS GAME REMEMBER THAT.
now enjoy

reviewText: This game is absoululey legendary the satisfaction of having your army smash against enemy lines on the outskirts of Stockholm is one of the most amazing feelings in gaming. Also as an added bonus while playing this game its really fun to start shouting "Hold the line!" and "The Ottomans are on their last leg!" in a British accent."

The only reason why I play this game is because I love the setting, It is probably my favorite era in history. Which is why it makes me sad that this game is full of bugs and glitches, I have to give this game a low score because I am judging how good the game itself is but because it is perhaps the best game in its time period I have to recommend buying this game if you love the 18th century.\n\n5.2/10

reviewText: This is a very good entertaining stratergy game and is personaly one of my favourates. It is extremely entertaining and the battles you fight are excelent. There are many different things you can do on this game and it is up to you how you choose to build your empire and because of this every time you replay empire total war it is just as enjoyable as the first time you played it. I highly recommend this game to anyone who is a fan of stratergy games and i would personaly rate it 9/10.

Here are a few reasons why you should get this game. firstly, it`s on sale. 50% Off. It can run on low end computers too, so don`t be worried that you will have problems. This game requires strategy. This isn`t another Call of Duty Game. Because if you use Call of Duty tactics, those brave horsemen on your team will be lying dead on the ground in no time. SO whatever you do, think logically. (e.g. Bringing ranged soldiers into close quarters combat). If you like startegy games that pay off for every action that is sucessful, I think this will become a great addition to your Steam Library, like it is for me :)\n\nHappy Gaming!
